item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 4:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok goes dark in the US (969 points | 1687 comments)
2. When America's Top Spies Were Academics and Librarians (42 points | 18 comments)
3. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (239 points | 169 comments)
4. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (142 points | 88 comments)
5. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (25 points | 7 comments)

7. The Fuzzing Book (21 points | 1 comment)
8. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (83 points | 10 comments)
9. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (65 points | 21 comments)
10. VS Code Pets (440 points | 116 comments)
11. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (68 points | 22 comments)
12. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (181 points | 34 comments)
13. “The Traitors”, a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (79 points | 55 comments)
14. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (193 points | 122 comments)
15. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (480 points | 183 comments)
16. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (113 points | 51 comments)
17. Open Dylan (29 points | 5 comments)
18. What Roman Coins Reveal About the People Who Made Them (3 points | discuss)

20. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (89 points | 53 comments)
21. Hologram: A full-stack isomorphic Elixir web framework (95 points | 26 comments)
22. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (191 points | 93 comments)
23. Alignment faking in large language models (29 points | 4 comments)
24. About A comprehensive guide for Linux Network (Socket) programming (7 points | 1 comment)
25. Volkswagen Sausage and the Enduring Appeal of Culinary Car-Industry Crossovers (9 points | 3 comments)
26. We need to protect the protocol that runs Bluesky (79 points | 113 comments)
27. Why do bees die when they sting you? (2021) (311 points | 224 comments)
28. Reverse Engineering a VanMoof E-Shifter – Part 2 – Decoding the Signals (30 points | 11 comments)
29. Generating an infinite world with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (248 points | 65 comments)
30. Tracing Military Command Chains Through Time and Location (77 points | 14 comments)
